info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued November 04 at 7:23PM CDT until November 05 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN PIKE...POLK AND SOUTHWESTERN MONTGOMERY COUNTIES... At 723 PM CDT, a confirmed tornado was located 10 miles west of Gillham, or 11 miles northwest of De Queen, moving northeast at 55 mph. This will track near Wickes. HAZARD...Damaging tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar confirmed tornado. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. Locations impacted include... Mena... Wickes... Grannis... Hatfield... Vandervoort... Little Missouri Falls Recreatio... Cossatot River State Park... Polk County Fairgrounds... Mena Intermountain Airport... Mccauley... Shady... Hartley... Bard Springs Recreation Area... Caney Creek Wilderness... Albert Pike Recreation Area... Cove... Acorn... Big Fork... Board Camp... Ink... TORNADO...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: To repeat, a tornado is on the ground. TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
